{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3343375,"name":"Matt Boehm","username":"Matt_Boehm_329","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/matt_boehm_329/{size}/202974_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T22:47:47.650Z","cooked":"

I have been making our bumpers for the past 3 years and I haven’t been seeing the failures that others are seeing but when I read bumper threads I find that I am doing some of the things that people say I shouldnt be doing. I’m curious to see if I am playing with fire here and just getting lucky or if something else is going on.

To start, the wood for our bumpers has been the same and survived for the 23 and 24 season, the noodles and fabric were refreshed this year. The wood is joined as a regular joint (no dovetail or box), glued and tacked while the glue dried, then 3, 3in wood screws predrilled in each corner to hold it together. The wood is oversized on the frame by about 1/8th gap on all sides. Mounting brackets are attached to the wood with 2 screws each and those brackets slide over the 1/4 20s that are used to mount MK4s to our 2x1x.125 frame. There are 4 brackets total and they are held down by 2 flange nuts. Please roast our bumpers.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T22:49:54.233Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":721,"readers_count":720,"score":159.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Matt Boehm","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/e/3/e3d20e35f58306efe72f1cbd15a9668e8e091399.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/7/5/75f50145389dcee4599aae089d923e17238a866c.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/d/e/de0807a77a4912f74d45076f563a91caaedb5e0b.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19742,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3343383,"name":"Camren","username":"Camren","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/camren/{size}/226239_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T23:08:36.083Z","cooked":"

As long as the boards are tight to the frame, your bumpers won’t break. The screws are a bit suspect from a fatigue standpoint, but if they wear out in comp you could always go in with a bigger screw.

The main cause of bumper failures has been because teams are at or near the 1/4" x 8" gap between bumper and frame perimeter allowed per R410. With gaps like if you hit the stage at a high speed your plywood may give.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T23:08:36.083Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":630,"readers_count":629,"score":146.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Camren","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16209,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343587,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T01:45:36.688Z","cooked":"

Looks like the same setup we run, but we only have one 10-32 on each mount that goes through the frame with a threaded piece of hex shaft finger tight to hold the bumpers on. So we just have to take four “thumb screws” off to remove bumpers for inspection.

With that being said, we did have to do a full rebuild today after last weekends competition. I have never seen so many breaks in plywood before. We had splits through 3,5, and all 7 plys in 6 different places. Every noodle in the bumpers were also pulverized with not a single one still in one piece.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T01:47:19.178Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":513,"readers_count":512,"score":102.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"MrBasse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #3572"},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/3","custom_user_title":"FRC #3572","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343625,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T02:16:25.896Z","cooked":"

Looks like you’re using .100 wall vex tubing which is quite robust especially if you have some internal structure or a strong belly pan. So I wouldn’t really expect to see frame bends. Since the wood doesn’t seem to have a gap to the frame the wood doesn’t need to be anything special to survive since the load goes straight to the robot’s frame without bending the wood.

As to why your fabric and noodles are surviving, it looks like you go to 1 or 2 competitions per year. There are a lot of teams going to more than 4 competitions per year, so it’s not surprising that your bumpers would last longer. Depending on how and how much you practice, that could also greatly reduce your wear and tear compared to some other teams. Different events can have more or less high speed collisions which could affect your bumpers as well.

So for example my team’s frame is .040” aluminum tubing with minimal support from its belly pan, so the bumpers must absorb most of the collision energy. We can not use normal plywood. We sustained frame damage when we ran a practice match with vanity bumper made from normal plywood. We also attend 6-8 competitions per year and drive the robot for many times more in full contact practice at the build space than in competition.

So if I had to guess, your bumpers probably see a whole lot less use.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T02:20:20.204Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":405,"readers_count":404,"score":86.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/4","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343631,"name":"Nick Foote","username":"Footie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T02:23:49.831Z","cooked":"

Your bumpers look pretty good. My only note would be, if the bracket somehow breaks off your frame, it is really close to your swerve drive, and might slice that belt up. I’d suggest moving the mount slightly further away from the module, if you have the space.

Also, how do you attach the nuts? Do you need to hold a tool on top and bottom so the bolts don’t spin, or do you have them loctited into a plug in the 2x1 or something?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T02:23:49.831Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":288,"readers_count":287,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Nick Foote","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student"},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/5","custom_user_title":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343635,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T02:27:08.101Z","cooked":"
Patrick3357:

So for example my team’s frame is .040” aluminum tubing

That is playing with fire to me. I see only danger in doing that since the frame is low and you want more weight low for cg so having thicker wall tubing is worth it to our team

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T02:27:08.101Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":59.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/6","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343638,"name":"Matt Boehm","username":"Matt_Boehm_329","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/matt_boehm_329/{size}/202974_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T02:28:37.150Z","cooked":"
Footie:

Also, how do you attach the nuts? Do you need to hold a tool on top and bottom so the bolts don’t spin, or do you have them loctited into a plug in the 2x1 or something?

The 1/4 20’s are loctited into the swerve plates so I’m guessing its kind of acts like tightening two nuts against each other? It fell into the “didn’t have a problem with it so didn’t question it” category. Its the same bolts that the swerve modules are attached with. I picked that because it “seemed good enough” and already riveted the belly pan on and didn’t want to drill more holes for bolts

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T02:28:37.150Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":246,"readers_count":245,"score":69.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Matt Boehm","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19742,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343648,"name":"Nick Foote","username":"Footie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T02:35:52.314Z","cooked":"

Gotcha, I ask because we’ve done similar things in the past, and at the worse possible times (like between playoff matches), the bolt side comes loose and then it takes much longer to swap bumpers because we have to have access to both sides in order to tighten it.

So this year we put a plug into the 2x1, tapped it and put the bolt through it, and then loctited that so it had more surface area to adhere to, rather than just the thickness of the plates. But that’s a change that’s a pain in the butt to make if you already have the chassis together.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T02:37:06.056Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":50.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Nick Foote","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19742,"username":"Matt_Boehm_329","name":"Matt Boehm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/matt_boehm_329/{size}/202974_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student"},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/8","custom_user_title":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343665,"name":"Matt Boehm","username":"Matt_Boehm_329","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/matt_boehm_329/{size}/202974_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T02:51:24.317Z","cooked":"

We had bumpers that were nearly press-fit to our frame and our driver still managed to shred the plywood near the corners lol

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-21T05:53:52.220Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Eli Van Hoy | 2996","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16209,"username":"Camren","name":"Camren","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/camren/{size}/226239_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62490,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"VP of Community Relations"},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/10","custom_user_title":"VP of Community Relations","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3450254,"name":"Alex McConnell","username":"AlexM","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-21T06:32:00.709Z","cooked":"

The 2024 robot for us (3357 same as patrick) was actually an exceptionally hard robot to tip, our cg was quite low especially relative to our wheel base size, for example our battery and 90% of our electronics were about half an inch off the carpet (with a solid 1/4 inch polycarb bellypan between them as well), and we also had a very short and dense design overall, so with the nature of our take on the 2024 game low cg was a problem that was largely solved from our initial design, however, the .04 wall tubing for frame structure is definitely something to be careful with, the rigidity of our bumpers and the way they mount meant that on impact very little side loaded force was put on the frame, most of the impact was absorbed by the bumpers and then into the bumper mounting which was securely mounted to the frame. All of this combined basically meant we built an 80 pound pin ball and we were not afraid to bounce off of just about anything.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-21T06:32:00.709Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":26.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460096,"topic_slug":"roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky","display_username":"Alex McConnell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53198,"username":"Thor5090","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47544,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/roast-our-bumpers-are-we-just-getting-lucky/460096/11","custom_user_title":"Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3450310,"name":"","username":"Tristan_Shepard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tristan_shepard/{size}/232239_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-21T13:10:01.027Z","cooked":"

how it going, here is how i and the teams i have been apart of have made bumpers for the last 10 years without any failures. the key is to use really good plywood with a high laminated layer count. I think the rules are going to change next year from the looks of it though. 2025-Bumper-Rule-Changes.pdf

here is a link to the onshape of how my teams in the past have done it. Drive_Base_Bumpers | 1_Bumber
